title: List of U.S. Open (golf) champions
text:
The <a href="U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">U.S. Open</a> is an annual <a href="golf">golf</a> competition established in 1895, with <a href="Horace%20Rawlins">Horace Rawlins</a> winning the inaugural championship. It is run by the <a href="United%20States%20Golf%20Association">United States Golf Association</a> (USGA). The championship was not held from 1917 to 1918 or from 1942 to 1945 due to <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> and <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> respectively.
The U.S. Open is currently the third of four <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major championships</a> to be played each year. U.S. Open champions are automatically invited to play in the other three majors (the <a href="Masters%20Tournament">Masters</a>, the <a href="The%20Open%20Championship">Open Championship</a> (British Open), and the <a href="PGA%20Championship">PGA Championship</a>) for the next five years, and earn a ten-year exemption from qualifying for the U.S. Open. They also receive membership on the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a> for the following five seasons and invitations to <a href="The%20Players%20Championship">The Players Championship</a> for the five years following their victories. The champion receives a gold champion's medal, and the U.S. Open Championship Cup, which the winner is allowed to keep for a year.
<a href="Willie%20Anderson%20%28golfer%29">Willie Anderson</a>, <a href="Bobby%20Jones%20%28golfer%29">Bobby Jones</a>, <a href="Ben%20Hogan">Ben Hogan</a> and <a href="Jack%20Nicklaus">Jack Nicklaus</a> hold the record for the most U.S. Open victories, with four victories each. Anderson holds the record for most consecutive wins with three (1903–05). <a href="Hale%20Irwin">Hale Irwin</a> is the oldest winner of the U.S. Open: he was old when he won in <a href="1990%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">1990</a>. The youngest winner of the U.S. Open is <a href="John%20McDermott%20%28golfer%29">John McDermott</a> who was old when he won in <a href="1911%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">1911</a>. <a href="Rory%20McIlroy">Rory McIlroy</a> holds the record for the lowest aggregate score in <a href="2011%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">2011</a> at 268. <a href="Rory%20McIlroy">Rory McIlroy</a> and <a href="Brooks%20Koepka">Brooks Koepka</a> share the record for the lowest score in relation to par with their winning scores of -16. 
The U.S. Open has been won <a href="Glossary%20of%20golf%23W">wire-to-wire</a> by seven golfers on eight occasions: 1914 by <a href="Walter%20Hagen">Walter Hagen</a>, 1921 by <a href="Jim%20Barnes">Jim Barnes</a>, 1953 by Hogan, 1970 by <a href="Tony%20Jacklin">Tony Jacklin</a>, 2000 and 2002 by <a href="Tiger%20Woods">Tiger Woods</a>, 2011 by McIlroy, and 2014 by <a href="Martin%20Kaymer">Martin Kaymer</a>. Eight others have led wire-to-wire in nine tournaments if ties after a round are counted: Willie Anderson in 1903, <a href="Alex%20Smith%20%28golfer%29">Alex Smith</a> in 1906, <a href="Chick%20Evans">Chick Evans</a> in 1916, <a href="Tommy%20Bolt">Tommy Bolt</a> in 1958, Nicklaus in 1972 and 1980, <a href="Hubert%20Green">Hubert Green</a> in 1977, <a href="Payne%20Stewart">Payne Stewart</a> in 1991, and <a href="Retief%20Goosen">Retief Goosen</a> in 2001.
